senses.de: Making progress towards a goal and likely to achieve it.
senses.ex: The project is on track to be completed by the end of the year.
cl: be on track to do something

Tips.title: Describing project progress
Tips.description: Use 'on track' to indicate that a project is progressing as planned and expected to meet its deadlines.
Tips.example: We're on track to finish the software development by next month.

Tips.title: Talking about personal goals
Tips.description: Use 'on track' to describe progress towards personal goals like weight loss, saving money, or learning a new skill.
Tips.example: I'm on track to lose 10 pounds by the summer.

on schedule.wordDefinition: 'On schedule' emphasizes adherence to a timetable, while 'on track' emphasizes progress towards a goal.  'On schedule' can be used for events with fixed times, while 'on track' is more general.

making progress.wordDefinition: 'Making progress' is a more general term. 'On track' implies not only progress but also that the progress is sufficient to reach the goal.

in line with expectations.wordDefinition: 'In line with expectations' focuses on meeting predicted outcomes. 'On track' suggests movement toward a goal and can imply overcoming obstacles.
